definition: to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
contrary to usual/unlike what usually happens

sentences.english: Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，你的屈尊俯就總是讓人感激。

sentences.english: Today is the Mid-Autumn Festival, but I get up late as usual.
sentences.chinese: 今天是中秋節，但我還是一如往常的晚起。

sentences.english: The 3-day conference will be held as usual in parallel with the PCIM Exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣3天的會議將與PCIM展會一起進行。

sentences.english: He routinely reprimanded employees at the top of his lungs.
sentences.chinese: 他如往常一樣聲嘶力竭地訓斥着手下的員工。

sentences.english: Has the devious Beijing government been massaging the numbers, as communist planners are wont to do?
sentences.chinese: 是朝令夕改的北京政府像往常一樣在修正數據嗎？

sentences.english: As usual, we'd like to hear your opinion.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，我們希望聽聽你的意見。

sentences.english: Hurricane forecasters expect this year's hurricane season to be busier than average.
sentences.chinese: 氣象預報員預計今年的颶風季會比往常更加頻繁。

sentences.english: Kapok, as usual, I go there to see a few, but you can see it.
sentences.chinese: 我像往常一樣往木棉花數那兒看，卻再也看不到了。

sentences.english: As always, the gin made him shudder and even retch slightly.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，他感到一陣哆嗦，甚至有些噁心。

sentences.english: Taxpayers are grumbling about the waste of government money,as usual.
sentences.chinese: 納稅人又像往常一樣抱怨政府浪費錢財。

sentences.english: The spring festival in 2015 . The red packages are not traditional .
sentences.chinese: 2015年春節紅包與往常相比變得不太一樣了。

sentences.english: As ever, I make absolutely no predictions whatsoever about short-term performance.
sentences.chinese: 和往常一樣，我對短期的趨勢不做任何預測。

sentences.english: Many more people than usual will catch flu this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年將有比往常多得多的人患上流感。
黛拉和往常一樣哭着，咳嗽着。

sentences.english: As is usually the case, after beer starts to flow, memory rewinds .
sentences.chinese: 如往常一樣，幾杯啤酒下肚後，記憶又甦醒了。

sentences.english: As usual Chinese toy with black body paint.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，塗着黑漆的中國玩具而已。

definition: complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic/entirely outside the norm/out of character
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
